member.name: T:Robotics.ProducerConsumer`1
member.summary: Implements a producer/consumer.
member.typeparam: Specifies the type of elements in the queue

member.name: F:Robotics.ProducerConsumer`1.queue
member.summary: The Queue object used to store data

member.name: F:Robotics.ProducerConsumer`1.count
member.summary: Number of elements contained in the ProducerConsumer. It allows read the number of elements in the queue asynchronously

member.name: F:Robotics.ProducerConsumer`1.capacity
member.summary: The number of elements that the ProducerConsumer can store

member.name: F:Robotics.ProducerConsumer`1.fixedSize
member.summary: Indicates if the ProducerConsumer has fixed size

member.name: F:Robotics.ProducerConsumer`1.discardExcedent
member.summary: Indicates if the the last element of the queue will be discarded when a new element is stored in a fixed size ProducerConsumer object.

member.name: M:Robotics.ProducerConsumer`1.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ProducerConsumer class.

member.name: M:Robotics.ProducerConsumer`1.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ProducerConsumer class.
member.param: The maximum number of elements that the ProducerConsumer can contain

member.name: M:Robotics.ProducerConsumer`1.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ProducerConsumer class.
member.param: The maximum number of elements that the ProducerConsumer can contain
Indicates if the ProducerConsumer has fixed size
Indicates if the the last element of the queue will be discarded when a new element is stored in a fixed size ProducerConsumer object.

member.name: M:Robotics.ProducerConsumer`1.Clear
member.summary: Removes all objects from the ProducerConsumer queue

member.name: M:Robotics.ProducerConsumer`1.Produce(`0)
member.summary: Adds an object to the end of the queue of the ProducerConsumer
member.param: The object to add to the ProducerConsumer. The value can be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) for reference types

member.name: M:Robotics.ProducerConsumer`1.Consume
member.summary: Removes and returns the object at the beginning of the queue of the ProducerConsumer
member.returns: The object that is removed from the beginning of the queue of the ProducerConsumer.

member.name: M:Robotics.ProducerConsumer`1.Consume(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes and returns the object at the beginning of the queue of the ProducerConsumer If the specified time-out interval elapses, the thread enters the ready queue and returns the default value of the type.
member.param: The number of milliseconds to wait for an element
member.returns: The object that is removed from the beginning of the queue of the ProducerConsumer.

member.name: M:Robotics.ProducerConsumer`1.ToArray
member.summary: Copies the ProducerConsumer<T> elements to a new array.
member.returns: A new array containing elements copied from the ProducerConsumer

member.name: P:Robotics.ProducerConsumer`1.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements contained in the ProducerConsumer

member.name: P:Robotics.ProducerConsumer`1.Capacity
member.summary: Gets the number of elements that the Queue can store

member.name: P:Robotics.ProducerConsumer`1.DiscardExcedent
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the the last element of the queue will be discarded when a new element is stored in a fixed size ProducerConsumer object. If the ProducerConsumer has fixed size and this value is set to false, the Produce method will block untill there is space in the queue
member.remarks: This value has not effect on non fixed size ProducerConsumer objects

member.name: P:Robotics.ProducerConsumer`1.FixedSize
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the ProducerConsumer has fixed size
member.remarks: A fixed size ProducerConsumer object will not increase the size of its queue. The exceding contained objects may be discarded depending on the value of the DiscardExcedent property

member.name: M:Robotics.API.PrimitiveSharedVariables.VectorSharedVariable.Deserialize(System.String,Robotics.Mathematics.Vector@)
member.summary: Deserializes an array of doubles from a string
member.param: String containing the serialized object

When this method returns contains the value stored in serializedData the deserialization succeeded, or zero if the deserialization failed. The deserialization fails if the serializedData parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) or its content could not be parsed. This parameter is passed uninitialized
member.returns: true if serializedData was deserialized successfully; otherwise, false

member.name: M:Robotics.API.PrimitiveSharedVariables.VectorSharedVariable.Serialize(Robotics.Mathematics.Vector,System.String@)
member.summary: Serializes the provided object to a string
member.param: Object to be serialized

When this method returns contains value serialized if the serialization succeeded, or zero if the serialization failed. The serialization fails if the serializedData parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) or outside the specification for the type. This parameter is passed uninitialized
member.returns: true if value was serialized successfully; otherwise, false

member.name: M:Robotics.Mathematics.MathUtil.Lerp(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Linearly interpolates between two values
member.param: Source value
Source value
Value between 0 and 1 indicating the weight of value2
member.returns: Interpolated value
member.remarks: This method performs the linear interpolation based on the following formula. value1 + (value2 - value1) * amount Passing amount a value of 0 will cause value1 to be returned, a value of 1 will cause value2 to be returned.

member.name: M:Robotics.Mathematics.MathUtil.Acos(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the angle whose cosine is the specified number. Values returned by this method are precalculated.
member.param: A number representing a cosine, where -1 ≤ d ≤ 1.
member.returns: An angle, θ, measured in radians, such that 0 ≤ θ ≤ π -or- NaN if d < -1 or d > 1.

member.name: M:Robotics.Mathematics.MathUtil.Asin(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the angle whose sine is the specified number. Values returned by this method are precalculated.
member.param: A number representing a sine, where -1 ≤ d ≤ 1.
member.returns: An angle, θ, measured in radians, such that -π/2 ≤ θ ≤π /2 -or- NaN if d < -1 or d > 1.

member.name: M:Robotics.Mathematics.MathUtil.Cos(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the cosine of the specified angle. Values returned by this method are precalculated.
member.param: An angle, measured in radians.
member.returns: The cosine of the provided angle. If a is equal to NaN, NegativeInfinity, or PositiveInfinity, this method returns NaN

member.name: M:Robotics.Mathematics.MathUtil.Sin(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the sine of the specified angle. Values returned by this method are precalculated.
member.param: An angle, measured in radians.
member.returns: The sine of the provided angle. If a is equal to NaN, NegativeInfinity, or PositiveInfinity, this method returns NaN

member.name: M:Robotics.Mathematics.MathUtil.Tan(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the tangent of the specified angle Values returned by this method are precalculated.
member.param: An angle, measured in radians.
member.returns: The sine of the provided angle. If a is equal to NaN, NegativeInfinity, or PositiveInfinity, this method returns NaN

member.name: M:Robotics.API.CommandExecuter.OnConsoleUpdated(System.String)
member.summary: Raises the OnConsoleUpdated Event
member.param: The text sent to the Console
member.remarks: The OnConsoleUpdated method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class. When overriding OnConsoleUpdated in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's OnConsoleUpdated method so that registered delegates receive the event

member.name: M:Robotics.API.CommandExecuter.OnExecutionAborted(Robotics.API.Command)
member.summary: Raises the ExecutionAborted Event and sends a failure response
member.param: The command which execution was aborted
member.remarks: The OnExecutionAborted method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class. When overriding OnExecutionAborted in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's OnExecutionAborted method so that registered delegates receive the event

member.name: M:Robotics.API.CommandExecuter.OnExecutionFinished(Robotics.API.Command,Robotics.API.Response)
member.summary: Raises the ExecutionFinished Event
member.param: The command which execution was finished
The response generated by the execution of the command (if any)
member.remarks: The OnExecutionFinished method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class. When overriding OnExecutionFinished in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's OnExecutionFinished method so that registered delegates receive the event

member.name: M:Robotics.API.CommandExecuter.OnExecutionStarted(Robotics.API.Command)
member.summary: Raises the ExecutionStarted event
member.param: The command which execution has been started
member.remarks: The OnExecutionStarted method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class. When overriding OnExecutionStarted in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's OnExecutionStarted method so that registered delegates receive the event

member.name: T:Robotics.API.SharedVariableStringSerializer`1
member.summary: Represents a function that will serialize the provided object to a string. Serialized strings must have the format: "dataType variableName variableData" or "dataType variableName[arraySize] variableData"
member.typeparam: Type of the object the function can serialize
member.param: Object to be serialized

When this method returns contains value serialized if the serialization succeeded, or zero if the serialization failed. The serialization fails if the serializedData parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) or outside the specification for the type. This parameter is passed uninitialized
member.returns: true if value was serialized successfully; otherwise, false

member.name: T:Robotics.API.SharedVariableStringDeserializer`1
member.summary: Represents a function that will deserialize the provided object from a string Serialized strings have the format: "dataType variableName variableData" or "dataType variableName[arraySize] variableData"
member.typeparam: Type of the object the function can deserialize
member.param: String containing the serialized object

When this method returns contains the value stored in serializedData the deserialization succeeded, or zero if the deserialization failed. The deserialization fails if the serializedData parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) or its content could not be parsed. This parameter is passed uninitialized
member.returns: true if serializedData was deserialized successfully; otherwise, false

member.name: T:Robotics.API.SyncCommandExecuter
member.summary: Serves as base class for classes which allow execute a Command synchronously
member.remarks: A SyncCommandExecuter blocks the CommandManager trhead until the execution of the command has been finished; therefore no other commands will be parsed or executed. If the execution of the command requires to wait for an event to occur (like incoming data) or takes more than a few lines of code or will take more than a few microseconds to execute, use instead an AsyncCommandExecuter.

member.name: F:Robotics.API.SyncCommandExecuter.busy
member.summary: Indicates if the executer is busy

member.name: F:Robotics.API.SyncCommandExecuter.running
member.summary: Flag that indicates if the asyncExecutionThread is running

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of SyncCommandExecuter
member.param: The Signature object for the command that the CommandExecuter will execute

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of SyncCommandExecuter
member.param: The Signature object for the command that the CommandExecuter will execute
The CommandManager object that will handle the command executed by this CommandExecuter instance

member.name: M:Robotics.API.SyncCommandExecuter.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of SyncCommandExecuter for the synchronous execution of a command
member.param: The name of the command that the SyncCommandExecuter will execute

member.name: M:Robotics.API.SyncCommandExecuter.#ctor(System.String,Robotics.API.CommandManager)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of SyncCommandExecuter for the aynchronous execution of a command
member.param: The name of the command that the SyncCommandExecuter will execute
The CommandManager object that will handle the command executed by this CommandExecuter instance

member.summary: Aborts the command execution
member.returns: false, since SyncCommandExecuter objects usually cannot be aborted

member.name: M:Robotics.API.SyncCommandExecuter.SyncTask(Robotics.API.Command)
member.summary: When overriden executes the provided command
member.param: Command object which contains the command to be executed
member.returns: The Response object result of provided command execution. If no response is required, must return null
member.remarks: If the command execution is aborted the execution of this method is canceled and a failure response is sent if required

member.name: M:Robotics.API.SyncCommandExecuter.Execute(Robotics.API.Command)
member.summary: Executes the provided command
member.param: Command object which contains the command to be executed
member.remarks: If the command execution is aborted a failure response is sent if required

member.name: M:Robotics.API.SyncCommandExecuter.DefaultParameterParser(System.String[])
member.summary: When overriden, receives the parameters of an analyzed command by the default Signature object as an array of strings
member.param: Array of strings containing the parameters of the command

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates if the SyncCommandExecuter is busy

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates if the CommandExecuter is running

member.name: P:Robotics.API.SyncCommandExecuter.ParametersRequired
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the executer requires parameters

member.name: P:Robotics.API.SyncCommandExecuter.Priority
member.summary: Gets the priority of this command. Valid values are between 0 (higest) and 255 (lowest) This value is used by the blackboard and has no effect on the execution of this CommandExecuter object

member.name: P:Robotics.API.SyncCommandExecuter.Timeout
member.summary: Gets the maxium amount of time the blackboard will wait for the execution of this command. Valid values are positive integers and given in milliseconds, it is advised to use values greater than 100 This value is used by the blackboard and has no effect on the execution of this CommandExecuter object

member.name: M:Robotics.API.PrimitiveSharedVariables.ByteArraySharedVariable.Deserialize(System.String,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Deserializes an array of integers from a string
member.param: String containing the serialized object

When this method returns contains the value stored in serializedData the deserialization succeeded, or zero if the deserialization failed. The deserialization fails if the serializedData parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) or its content could not be parsed. This parameter is passed uninitialized
member.returns: true if serializedData was deserialized successfully; otherwise, false

member.name: M:Robotics.API.PrimitiveSharedVariables.ByteArraySharedVariable.Serialize(System.Byte[],System.String@)
member.summary: Serializes the provided object to a string
member.param: Object to be serialized

When this method returns contains value serialized if the serialization succeeded, or zero if the serialization failed. The serialization fails if the serializedData parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) or outside the specification for the type. This parameter is passed uninitialized
member.returns: true if value was serialized successfully; otherwise, false

member.name: M:Robotics.API.Response.TryParse(System.String,Robotics.API.Response@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a response to a Response object. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeded or not. A string containing the response to convert When this method returns, contains the Response equivalent to the response contained in s, if the conversion succeeded, or null if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) or is not of the correct format. This parameter is passed uninitialized
member.returns: true if conversion was successfull, false otherwise

member.name: P:Robotics.Mathematics.Matrix.FastDeterminant
member.summary: Calculates the determinant of the matrix. It computes the determinant by reducing the matrix to reduced echelon form using row operations. The function is very fast and efficient but may oerflow in some cases returning NaN. In such cases use the Matrix.Determinant property which computes determinent using minors

member.name: P:Robotics.Mathematics.Matrix.FastInverse
member.summary: Gets the inverse matrix The function returns the inverse of the current matrix using Reduced Echelon Form method The function is very fast and efficient but may cause overflow in some cases returning Null In such cases use the Inverse property which computes inverse using adjugate / determinant

member.name: M:Robotics.API.Command.TryParse(System.String,Robotics.API.Command@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a command to a Command object. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeded or not. A string containing the command to convert When this method returns, contains the Command equivalent to the command contained in s, if the conversion succeeded, or null if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) or is not of the correct format. This parameter is passed uninitialized
member.returns: true if conversion was successfull, false otherwise
